messages.message: yup i just updated after checking requirements.txt. would it be a good idea to have a check somewhere to show that you’re not up-to-date with requirements.txt?
I am not sure if it would be the “right” way to do it, but you could check the MD5 of the current in master remotely against the local version. If they don’t match, throw a warning.
In this case, he’s already done a `git pull` (otherwise it wouldn’t have had the code using the google module), so his local copy would/should match the remote version.
Oh right. I guess then I amend that to be “checked against a retained MD5 from the last build”
Maybe a `post-merge` hook to see if the requirements.txt file has changed when doing a `git pull` or `merge`?
